comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: According to this 1890 map of Sydney, those are segregated Baths on the left, where Andrew Boy Charlton Pool is now. www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview?pi=nla.map-rm1280-s1-sd&rg... The modern looking roof at the bottom is the temporary Art Gallery - "Intended to be the foundation of a more substantial building when funds became available, Hunt's temporary building, which was nothing more than a series of thick walls with a sawtooth roof, was universally disliked. It was denounced in the press by prominent citizens as the 'Art Barn.' " www.artgallery.nsw.gov.au/aboutus/history/building

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Here's an 1893 Sydney Mail item on the Garden Island sheerlegs...they were evidently given their first test lift on 10/7/1893 - news.google.com/newspapers?id=2jRVAAAAIBAJ&sjid=CJUDA...
